inn1.comm: on the pads, flicked away to open the Bangladeshi account
what a fall from grace!! Run-a-ball 73 in the last game, golden duck today for Nafees! Swung away from the left-hander a touch, Nafees nibbled fatally to the keeper. Perfect start for New Zealand
on middle and leg, solidly defended back down the track
slightly shorter than the previous ball but same result
down leg, hits him on the pad, they scamper a single but it was also a no-ball.  Free hit  coming up.
skied to midwicket who takes the catch which doesn't count, run taken
inside-edges the drive to midwicket, end of a successful over for the Kiwis
loosener first up from Tuffey, on leg and moving away a touch, pushed out to cover
Tuffey escapes with a dot after a gentle delivery down leg which Kayes cannot take advantage of, gets hit on the pad
on leg again, defends to midwicket
better line on middle, played back down the line
clipped off the pads to the left of Redmond at midwicket who makes a good tumbling stop. Redmond's Facebook fan club will be delighted with his inclusion today
outside off, looked to have rolled the fingers on it, Kayes gets an edge which falls short of and beats gully, good diving save on the boundary keeps it to two which was checked upstairs
outside off, goes after it with limited foot movement, misses
attempted heave over mid-on ends up going down to the fine leg fence, French cut gets Siddique his first boundary
flicked off the inner half of the bat out to deep square
more bounce this time outside off, Kayes again goes with the hands not the feet and misses
very wide half-volley, Kayes reaches and gets a decent amount of bat on it but straight to point
short ball outside off, Kayes sways out of harm's way
down leg side, misses the attempted nudge, wide given
this time Tuffey pays for this leg stump line, picked up and put away just wide of a diving midwicket
again on the pads, Tuffey struggling with the left-handers, worked out to deep backward square
feeling of ad nauseum here, again clipped off the pads to deep square leg, completely wrong line from Tuffey
Kayes charges down and to leg, tries to slog over the on side, misses and gets hit on the pad, that would have been a wide had Kayes not moved to leg
yet again down leg, Kayes again fails to capitalise and gets rapped on the pad
horrendous half-tracker on leg stump, Kayes leans back and slams it to the deep backward square leg boundary, extremely poor start from Tuffey
short on leg, Siddique is quickly onto the back foot and crunches it away to the midwicket fence
better line and length fron Mills, fuller and on middle, Siddique jabs it away towards cover
this time on off, Siddique tries to work a single but plays straight to point
tries to repeat the boundary from earlier in the over, but this time picks out Redmond at midwicket who takes the catch with ease
full outside off but rolls the fingers on that one, dug out to cover
angling into the right-hander's pads, worked to midwicket
full and wide of off, Kayes angles the drive to deep third man
142.5kph, good pace, outside off, defended into the covers
short outside off with enough room given, allows Raqibul to cut it away to the fence
going towards the leg stump, flicked to square leg
touch of in-swing, Raqibul pushes it to the left of mid-off
on the left-hander's pads, clipped away for a simple couple
short on middle and leg, tucked down to fine leg
lovely cover-drive to a half-volley outside off, well placed between the cover and mid-off fieldsmen
short on leg, flicked fine, with fine leg up in the circle that was always heading to the fence
short of a length on off, goes back and guides into the off side
nice delivery, slanting across and then late swing away beating Kayes who tries to defend away from his pad
short on off, wristed to midwicket
full toss which swings in slightly, played back to Bennett

maiden ODI wicket for Bennett!! excellent delivery as well, steamed in and short on off, came back in a touch, Raqibul tried to run it down to third man but only succeeds in chopping on. Great moment for the debutant
very easy on the eye is Shakib, on the pads and wonderfully put away to the square leg fence
on middle, punched over the top of the bowler's head and Shakib sets off for a well-taken single
this time too far down leg to Kayes, beats the flick but wide
full on the toes, dug out to deep square leg
this time closer to middle but the yorker slightly off direction, allows the batsman to clip it fine
short and wide, easily put away through backward point, Shakib making a busy and positive start to his innings
tap and run to a ball outside off, defended with soft hands
beautiful delivery, forced Kayes to defend and then moved away a fraction after pitching
outside off, square driven (or cut) straight to point
this time moves back in a touch, full on middle, played down to mid-off
on middle, leading edge to cover, he was trying to work that to midwicket
short but comfortably down leg, wide called
on leg stump, Shakib tries to flick but is hit on the pad, dribbles to the off side
this time full down leg side, wide again, Bennett just needs to recalibrate his lines to the left-hander
yorker outside off, Shakib jams it out to off
full toss outside off but punched straight to mid-off
better line now, yorker on off stump with some pace, well dug out again by Shakib
slightly overcompensates here, wider of off and a beautifully struck straight drive is the result
short on off, clipped to the leg side by Shakib
starts on leg stump, worked to fine leg
airy drive from Shakib just wide of short cover who gets a hand to it but cannot prevent the single
tossed up outside off, pushed into the covers
fuller this time, driven to mid-off
full toss which was dipping quickly onto middle, Kayes plays a risky sweep
skids on towards off, slightly squares up Shakib who gets a partial leading edge but straight into the ground, trying to work to leg
bit of turn away from the left-hander, pushed to point
driven to mid-off
down leg and swept to fine leg on the fence
goes on towards leg, hurriedly worked away
on off stump and wristily worked away into the gaps on the leg side
on middle and off, driven back to the bowler
on middle and leg, cramps the left-hander who squeezes it out with the turn
tossed up on leg, helped fine
thinks about a big shot, dug out back to Vettori
backs away and cuts off middle into the gap
only 75.9kph, Kayes had to wait an age before defending
worked to the short midwicket
very fortunate escape for Shakib who inexplicably goes for a slog to leg against the spin, swirls out of Watling's reach at midwicket. The kind of brain explosion that has hurt Bangladesh in the past
pushed into the covers
mistimed cut back down the pitch
fired in flat on off, unconvincingly driven to cover
similar to the last ball, defended into the covers
on middle, dangerously worked down to fine leg.
tossed up on middle and off, Shakib goes back and whips away to deep square
beats the attempted sweep, going on towards off
skips down the track and works to mid-on
shorter, Shakib rocks back and slaps to point
beautifully bowled on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
same as before but this time Shakib waits a fraction longer and works to fine leg
punched off the back foot to long-off despite the bowler's half-stop
drives to cover
faster on off, Kayes jabs it to point with little footwork
tossed up, Kayes waits for it and flays it with the turn to the cover boundary
full toss and whacked down the ground to long-off
more air but Shakib waits and uses the wrists a touch to work to long-off
pushed to long-on from the middle and leg line
loud appeal for lbw, misses the sweep, struck on off, maybe missing but a close call
pushed to long-on
walks across and flips it to fine leg
not in full control there, worked away in the air to deep midwicket
flicked to the right of the square leg fielder
tossed up and nicely pushed with the full face to long-off
this time worked to long-on
squeezed inside-out to cover
down leg and swept to deep fine leg
shorter on middle, worked off the hips to square leg
comes forward and pushes with soft hands into the covers

silly way for a well-set batsman to go, tries the lap sweep from on off, top-edges up in the air, McCullum makes good ground from behind the stumps and dives on the pitch to complete a well-taken catch. Can New Zealand push on from here?
nicely played with the full face back to Vettori
defends into the pitch
squeezed out to midwicket
appeal for lbw, he propped forward, maybe an inside edge or outside the line
worked away into the deep on the off side
cuts back in, Mushfiqur inside edges into the pad
short on off, Shakib backs away a touch and opens the face to point
well-hit from Shakib to bring up the 100 for Bangladesh, full outside off and Shakib pierces the off-side field with a cover drive
short on leg, helped down to fine leg
moves in, drives on the bounce to short cover
punched into the covers
shorter, Mushfiqur adjusts and tucks behind square leg
appeal for lbw, struck on the pad after beating the sweep, hit outside the line and going past off, leg-byes run
worked to fine leg
good diving save at midwicket prevents the flick off leg stump from garnering a single
goes back and cuts well into the backward point region, fielded on the fence
full on middle, squeezed out to long-off
outside off, a step down the track, leans into the cover drive, dive at cover partially stops it and saves two, Tuffey also prevents the boundary on the fence
inside-edges the drive into his pad
drifts down leg, nipped to fine leg
on middle and wristily flipped to the right of fine leg
outside off, chipped in the air to long-off
short of a length outside off, Mushfiqur waits and chops down to third man
full outside off, keeps low, jammed out into the covers
slightly slower, results in a mistimed drive back to the bowler
punched off the back foot to long-off
back of the hand slower ball, takes an age to get to the other end, dug out to cover, who fires a sharp throw to the non-striker's end
goes for the big sweep, inside edges to square leg
well outside off, carves the square drive into the deep
tossed up but outside leg, Shakib almost overbalances but is able to work to fine leg
comes back in, Mushfiqur goes back and dabs to point against the turn
misses the whip to leg, dribbles off the pad
driven slightly on the up to cover
moves into middle, tucked to square leg
Dhoni-like whippage but not to the same extent, out into the covers
down leg, hit on the pad, Elliott appeals more in hope than expectation
defends off the back foot, rolls down to long-on
goes against the round the wicket angle to work into the covers
clipped to midwicket
squeezed out against the turn to cover
punched to the close-in fieldsman on the off side
full toss on leg, lets the ball hit the bat, rolls to square leg, excellent 50 up for Shakib in a situation of need for his side
works with the turn to square leg
tries to work to long-on but only succeeds in hitting back to the bowler
again nudged to square leg
loose ball on leg stump, Shakib helps it to the vacant fine leg boundary
punched out to cover
wristily opens the face, plays to third man
goes for the drive, only gets it to cover
well-executed lap sweep-cum-ramp from Shakib off off stump, a further beating for the ground down at fine leg
worked towards mid-on, Taylor runs around to prevent the one
drives on bent knee to the cover sweeper
dropped short on middle, keeps low but Shakib goes through with the pull shot which beats the midwicket sweeper
this time slog sweeps to cow corner, absolutely no chance for the man patrolling the deep on the leg side
paddle sweeps from outside off, pops up into the open areas at square and fine leg
flicked to mid-on
down leg, worked to fine leg
on middle, comes in, Mushfiqur adjusts with a straight bat to mid-on who can only partially cut it off
drives to cover
mistimes the drive to mid-on
squeezed into the off side

calamitous mix-up results in the end of Mushfiqur, Shakib drove on the up and set off for the single, Mushfiqur didn't want it, by the time Shakib decided to go back (having slipped over in the process) Mushfiqur had decided to go for the run, which meant that although the first throw went to Shakib's end, the keeper was alert to the problems at the other end and threw to the bowler with Mushfiqur well out. Key partnership broken
worked to point, single not taken despite being on offer, nervous running after the run-out
lovely cover drive which teases the fieldsman before hitting the rope
similar stroke, this time out to the cover sweeper
wristed to long-on
short on off, opens the face off the back foot and plays behind point
initially comes forward before rocking back and cutting away into the deep
flighted outside off, pushed to third man
drives to long-on despite Vettori's valiant dive which gets some fingers to the ball
on leg, waits and plays with soft hands into the leg side
tossed up on leg, wristily worked to the midwicket sweeper
goes back and carves to point
nicely bowled, 76.8kph, flighted on middle, Mahmudullah defends
deposits a length ball outside off over long-on with nonchalant ease
punched to mid-off
short on leg, paddles airily into the leg side
full and straight, worked to midwicket
outside off, partly steered, partly edged, the end result is a boundary to third man
slower ball on off, defends to cover
driven down to long-off
a little bit of outside edge in that defensive stroke to point
this time defends down the pitch
nicely played into the covers from outside off, inside-out against the spin
tries to repeat the stroke but picks out the fielder
tossed up, goes back to cut but misses
outside off and pushed into the covers
tries to bang it in on leg but it sits up and is pulled down to fine leg
nice inswinging yorker, squirts out a French cut
played to short cover
Shakib opens the face a la Sourav Ganguly to point
clipped off the pads past Watling at midwicket
tries to lap sweep but top edges it over the keeper down to third man
very slow from Elliott, Mahmudullah eventually keeps it out after waiting patiently for it to arrive
pushed into the off side
thinks of playing but withdraws the bat at the last moment. McCullum appeals for a stumping but Mahmudullah's back foot never lifted at any stage, as confirmed by the third umpire
outside off, left alone
bouncer!! Mahmudullah ducks, in fact it's called wide! All that effort from Elliott comes to nothing
pushed into the off side
chopped down to third man off his body
good bouncer which is ducked under
another short delivery ducked under, no wide given
outside off, brings it back in a touch, drives into the deep on the off side
punched to long-off
goes for the cut, beats the bat and keeps a bit low, McCullum (still with no pads on) pouches it behind the stumps
Tuffey back into the attack, first delivery is played back down the pitch
waits on the slower ball outside off and dabs it down to third man
outside off, slightly short, Mahmudullah is having nothing to do with it
tries to defend with soft hands but the ball travels quickly to point
fuller this time, props onto the front foot to defend
fiddles outside off with feet rooted, keeper and bowler go up but no affirmative decision is forthcoming from the umpire
back of the hand slower ball lands well outside off and cuts back in, chopped to cover
punched to long-on off the back foot
nudged off middle stump into the deep on the leg side
this time the slower ball is picked, drills it through the covers and gives the kboundary rider no chance
shows the full face and works to long-on
pushed off the front foot to short cover
tries to force off the front foot but goes back and mistimes to mid-on
rolls the fingers, chopped back to the bowler
gets off strike after the break in concentration, worked off the pads to deep square leg
short ball on off, Mahmudullah jumps up and rides the bounce, opens the face down to third man
short and wide outside off, beautifully carved off the back foot
punched back down the pitch
dabbed to third man to bring up the 200 for Bangladesh
digs out a very full ball on middle
punched to mid-off
tries to work to leg, inside edges into the pad
goes back and hits to long-on
worked to square leg
drives back to Vettori
moves to 99 with a clip to long-on
full toss drifting into leg, jabbed out into the off side
how was he not bowled there? moved to leg to cut, chopped past the off stump into McCullum's toe and rolls into the leg side

down leg and flicked fine, and a brilliant hundred for Shakib!! 5th ODI ton and 1st against the Black Caps, superb innings under pressure and he has given his side a great chance here to win the series
gets down and slog sweeps into the deep
cut away into the deep
reverse sweeps a full toss on off down to the vacant third man boundary
spins down leg, wide called
worked to square leg off the toes
tries to open the face, hits the edge of the blade and goes in the opposite direction towards midwicket
full toss on leg, clipped into the deep
full on middle, defends into the pitch
rocks back and hammers the cut into the off side where the cover sweeper Bennett fields excellently to only allow a single
pushed back down the ground
Shakib departs!! Gentle chip back to his opposite number, soft way to depart but his has been an invaluable innings which has set up a launch pad for the final overs assault
defends softly
paddles fine down leg
drives to long-off on the front foot
middled to midwicket
defends into the off side
laps to fine leg
attempts a big drive through the off side, gets a thick edge down to third man
tentatively pushed to midwicket
goes for the big drive, doesn't get the elevation, on the bounce to mid-off
tucked to the right of Vettori at midwicket
nice short ball on off, Shuvo fends in an ungainly fashion but the ball whizzes past the outer edge
pokes the bat out and gets a thick edge to third man
slower ball, Shuvo goes forward to defend but is surprised by the bounce, goes back but it hits high on the blade and falls to the ground
punched into the covers, easy single as the man on the edge of the ring makes no movement forward
good short ball, Shuvo can only sway out of the line
backs away and pushes the short ball into the off side, goes for the single but is sent back, Elliott's throw narrowly misses the stumps
swing and a miss outside off stump, you can only wonder what would have happened had Shakib been in
finally gets bat on ball and actually gets quite a bit as he pummels a length ball to the cow corner boundary
well bowled, full on middle, Shuvo inside edges into the pad, they scamper through as the ball rolls into the off side
goes for a slog to leg, goes off the toe of the bat to mid-off
short on leg, Shuvo heaves straight down Williamson's throat at square leg
clipped off the pads to midwicket
edges outside off down to third man
goes for a leg-side slog, gets just enough bat to clear mid-on
short ball on leg, Razzak hurries back and drops it into the leg side
knocks out the middle stump with a full yorker after the batsman backed away and tried to slash through the off side
played down to third man
misses the full toss outside off stump
short ball into the ribs, Razzak takes a hand off the bat and squeezes it to leg
pushed wide of off stump after the batsman backed away, misses the swipe

this time follows the batsman with a short ball, Shafiul tries to give himself room, top edges a cramped pull shot through to the keeper, Bangladesh failing to make the most of the platform laid by Shakib in the Powerplay
short ball, top edges the pull high in the air, Vettori at mid-off settles underneath it and pouches it safely

inn2.comm: short on off and moving in, McCullum mistimes it down towards mid-on
fuller on off, defended back down the pitch
opens the face and pushes it down to third man
bit of bounce there, on off and rises, McCullum plays awkwardly into the off side
ooh! similar to his dismissal in the last game, pushed out the bat to a ball swinging away, no bat on ball this time
gets a good forward stride in and defends solidly to short cover
leans into a cover drive which is threaded through the gap
comes forward to defend, gets an inside edge towards square leg
pushes at the ball outside off, doesn't get the foot across, inside edges into the pad, low bounce there
defends
goes back and punches into the off side, lot of turn there
plays the stroke that got him off the mark but this time picks out the cover fielder
charges down the track, Shafiul follows him with a length ball, swings to deep midwicket
goes down leg, brushes the pad, keeper goes up and appeals raucously, umpire says no
a tad straighter this time, allows Watling to work it off the pads
again drifts into the pads, clipped away into the deep
shorter but still on leg stump, Watling is again able to flick it away
short ball on middle, McCullum pulls to the left of fine leg who pulls off an excellent diving save, bit of hesitation but the batsmen eventually get through with ease
McCullum puts on those dancing shoes from the 1st ODI and lofts Razzak over cover
this time inside edges to square leg
on off, Watling props forward and defends
pulls the length back a touch, hits the bat high as Watling tries to defend, runs away to third man
on the toes and clipped away to deep midwicket
gone! pitched on off, kept going on with the arm, beats Watling's forward defensive, looks like it was hitting leg. Early blow for Bangladesh
worked off the pads to midwicket again
goes back and defends a shortish ball into the covers
Redmond opens his account with a clip off the pads down to deep backward square
slower ball outside off, McCullum waits and glides it wide of deep third man who has to run around and collect
shorter on off, works it into the midwicket area
leaves alone a fairly wide delivery outside off stump
flighted outside off, defended to short cover
drifts onto the pads, clipped fine
comes forward but shifts the weight back to defend
goes on with the arm on middle, Redmond defends well though
nicely struck from Redmond, cleanly hit, lofted drive back over the bowler's head to a full ball on middle
goes back and defends to mid-on
charges down the track and thwacks it back past the bowler, not out of the middle but still easily reaches the rope
this one was on off and middled but straight back to the bowler who held onto an excellent reflex catch. One of New Zealand's key men departs
left alone outside off stump
short outside off, Taylor gets a thick edge past the slip fielder but Rubel prevents a boundary with a committed save
short outside off, Redmond decides to sway out of the way
peach of a delivery as Geoffrey Boycott would say, angled in and moved away off the seam to beat Redmond's defensive poke
goodness me! Filthy long hop first up from Shuvo, Taylor rocks back and hoicks it straight down deep square leg's throat! Two key men gone within the first Powerplay for New Zealand
goes back and punches to short cover
short down leg, goes back and pulls it into the ground, excellent running gets them two
defends a straight delivery angled in
gives it some air, caressed into the covers
pushed through flat, Redmond defends on leg stump
down leg, strikes the pad beating the flick, rolls to backward square
moves across to cover the stumps and defends
short  again but on off, Williamson defends off the back foot
beats the flick but comfortably down leg, wide given, first extra of the innings
this time defends into the leg side
full on middle and off, Williamson clips towards mid-on and runs, Razzak picks up and attempts to throw but it pops out of his hand
on off, defends to point
goes on towards leg, clipped away
worked off the pads in front of square
nicely flighted on middle, Williamson comes forward and eventually defends
goes back and punches down the pitch
repeats the stroke but this time finds cover
good use of the feet, first time by a New Zealand batsman not called Brendon McCullum, comes down and flicks into the space to the right of mid-on
on the pads and clipped away, hard running earns them a couple
works it to midwicket, oh wait, misfield, straight through the legs, poor fielding, didn't even get down
punches the drive to mid-off
slower ball outside off, chops it down to third man
short on off, Williamson stands tall and defends
short ball which Williamson ducks underneath, not much bounce in the wicket as it didn't get up too high
puts it on the pads, worked fine
slightly shorter, clipped to the right of fine leg, good diving stop
well down leg, sweep missed
comes down but gets hit on the pad looking to flick
fired into the bootlaces, clipped to midwicket
drives back along the ground to the bowler
moves across to flick, misses, 50 up for the New Zealanders
comes down to defend, gets hit on the pad
pushed into middle, driven back
into the pads, clipped straight to midwicket
tossed up a bit, goes back and clips behind square
flighted on middle and off, hits the inside half of the bat while looking to defend
worked to midwicket
tries a wristy VVS Laxman flick but yet again hits to midwicket, a man in demand
tossed up on the pads, nudged away
comes forward to defend
shorter length which allows Williamson to go back and flip it away into the deep
driven to mid-on off the back foot
worked to fine leg, Williamson sets off, Redmond hesitates for a moment but makes it comfortably
played to mid-on
comes down the track and whips it through the mid-on region, well played
way down leg, gets bat to ball playing the sweep, beats fine leg which allows them to come back
goes back to punch through the covers
outside off, goes for the drive and inside edges into the pad
defends on middle
arm ball outside off, fired in full, Redmond goes back and crouches awkwardly before chopping to point
picks out fine leg with the lap sweep
comes down but the length is shortened, defends
square drives off the back foot to point
lovely use of the feet, comes down and hits over midwicket, first boundary for more than 9 overs
sweeps from middle stump out to deep square
tap and run into the leg side
shorter on off, drifts in and moves away to beat Redmond's attempted defensive stroke
driven to long-off
onto the front foot quickly, punches into the covers after moving the weight back
comes forward to defend, tries to nick a single but the fielders converge

goes on with the arm and hits the pad on middle, plumb in front. Redmond thinks he may have got bat to it first but it appears that the ball ricocheted into the bat off the pad, New Zealand's best partnership of the innings is broken, and disappointment for the Redmond fan club
defends into the off side
goes back and hits into the covers
comes forward and plays with a straight bat
chopped past backward point into the deep
wider outside off, bounces more than expected and beats the attempted dab
goes back and works to the leg-side sweeper
down leg, swept to the boundary rider at backward square, Williamson's younger legs race back for two
drives back down the pitch
goes back and successfully dabs this time past third man
opens the blade and pushes towards point
goes on towards off, more bounce and Vettori defends with the upper half of the bat
goes back and slaps it to the cover sweeper
eased to midwicket
defends down the pitch
sweeps to square leg, Williamson sets off and is sent back by Vettori, throw nearly takes his head off
clipped to cow corner
swung just over the arms of midwicket, mid-on runs around to collect
comes down and flicks through Williamson's legs to long-on
defends to midwicket
beautiful, drifted into middle and spins away from the bat, Vettori has moved out of his crease but Mushfiqur can't collect, missed stumping in the end
but Vettori doesn't make them pay! hits a ball outside off straight into cover's hands. Death blow for the Kiwis??
gets off the mark with a lap sweep
worked to midwicket
stands up and drives to the bowler
gets the placement better this time and drives to long-on
drifts in and spins away from the right-hander, driven to the bowler's left where Shakib gets a hand to it
comes down, not to the pitch but swings through the line and connects handsomely, sends it over long-on
two in a row! short ball, goes back and pulls beautifully over midwicket. Great batting from the youngster
drives past cover
Elliott chips down and plays back to Shakib
defends with soft hands
on-driven into the deep
Elliott advances to defend
comes down again and is hit on the pad looking to defend, appeal but he was well down the track
goes back this time and works fine
short on middle, goes back and beats the bowler while hitting to long-on
way down leg, Elliott connects with the sweep but can't beat fine leg. That was certainly a wide had he left it
tossed up on middle and leg, defends to square leg
goes back and again plays the Dravid force shot down to long-on
defends, from within the crease this time
comes down to defend and again is hit on the pad
hangs back and then leans forward, nicely plays through the covers and beats the sweeper
punched down to long-off
down leg, bat and pad involved as it goes down to fine leg, pad first
short outside off, back-foot drive straight to cover
outside off, again plays to cover but this time on the front foot
comes a few paces down and again hits to cover
strays onto the pads with a full ball which is flicked out to deep backward square
wider outside off and punches through the gap to the cover sweeper
floated down leg, worked deep to the sweeper
advances and defends
drives a ball pitched outside off through the covers
on off, keeps a tad low as he hits to cover
goes across the crease and sweeps
stabs the bat at a ball on leg, inside edge rolls to short leg area which is vacant
fast and straight, defends with the full face to cover
on leg, goes down and works away to deep square
can only play a shorter ball on off back to Rubel
tries to defend with soft hands but too much bat as it reaches cover at a fair clip
misses out with a short ball wide of off, went for the drive when a horizontal bat shot may have been the better option
flicked out to the leg-side sweeper
spiteful bounce there, often happens when Shakib shortens the length, hit high on the blade
guided to third man
lapped down to fine leg
inside-edged into his pads as he defends with bat away from pad
advances and again with little success, can only push it back to Shakib
stays back and nurdles through cover, alert running picks up a couple
short ball moves back in, punched back past the bowler, sets off for the single, direct hit but Williamson was comfortably in
punched into the off side
flicked into the leg side
whipped off middle stump for a couple to bring up a maiden 50 for Williamson, has batted well so far but needs to convert this into a maiden ton
pushed through the covers
full on off, Elliott can only dig out to the bowler
defended back down the track
on leg, paddle sweeps fine
again comes down and again can't make significant contact, pushed to the bowler
flicked to deep midwicket
flighted outside off, beats the attempted drive with slight turn away
reaches outside off to paddle into the fine leg area where Mushfiqur runs to from behind the stumps to field
drives back down the pitch, kept a bit low as Williamson looks at the ground and his bat
well struck flick to midwicket is stopped by a valiant dive
punched off the back foot to mid-on
again punched off the back foot, finds the fielder again as mid-off rushes in
drives to cover on the up
well struck from Williamson, the pressure had built in that over but he prevents the maiden by dragging a ball from well outside off to the cow corner boundary with a fierce pull
Elliott goes back and pushes to cover
comes down and check drives to long-off, 50 partnership up which is keeping New Zealand in the game
goes back and hits through the off side
short and wide of off, Elliott picks out the fielder at point, opportunity missed
similar to the previous ball but fuller which sees the stroke go in front of square out to the cover sweeper
premeditates the lap sweep around the corner
whipped from off to square leg
walks across but can only defend
mistimes the drive to mid-on
moves across and gets an inside edge onto the pad, rolls into the leg side, loud lbw appeal, he would have been out had he not got bat on that
worked in front of square on the leg side
goes back and pushes to cover
beautifully flighted on leg beating the attempted flick but pitched just outside leg
carved to the sweeper on the off side
full toss punched down to long-on
goes back and defends back down the pitch very late
this time comes forward quickly to defend
chips down the track and drives all along the ground to long-off
nicely flighted, comes down but is not quite to the pitch so leans back to defend
worked into the leg side off the back foot
paddle sweeps fine
moves across and drives off the back foot to cover
comes down but the ball is fired in, can only clip off the toes into the deep
comes down but the shortened length forces forces Elliott to defend
full toss on leg worked to long-on
full and in the blockhole, dug out and although Shafiul gets a hand to it, they race through for a single
strays on the pads and worked out to deep midwicket
full toss outside off, Elliott times it well but picks out cover, that is the kind of delivery that needs to be put away in the Powerplay
digs a full ball outside off to the cover region
excellent stroke from Williamson, comes down and creates a full toss which he flicks past the leg side fielders in the circle behind square

short length, Elliott has to reach trying to paddle, top edges high in the air where Razzak takes an excellent catch as he is running over his shoulder. Similarities with Kapil Dev's running catch in the 1983 World Cup final
Williamson goes back and punches to long-on. While running the single he is afflicted by a cramp attack and barely makes the single as he hobbles through
defends back down the wicket
squeezed into the off side
gets a thick leading edge to a full toss outside off, goes to third man on the bounce. Severe cramping everytime he plays a stroke
pushed into the covers, more cramping for Williamson who is almost having involuntary twitching
flicked into the leg side
Mills swings to deep square leg with the inner half of the bat
flicked to long-on, more cramping
full toss down leg, Mills aims up the leg side but misses, gets struck on the pads, ricochets into the off side
slower ball outside off, guided straight to third man
can only work a full ball on leg stump into the deep, he has to be wary of stepping out of his crease with his cramp attacks as he can still be run out
flicks the full toss into the deep on the leg side, Taylor and Mills run like hares to make the couple
decides to play a shot with the cramp, full toss going down leg, slams it to the square leg boundary
played to point
defends to mid-on
sweeps to fine leg, Taylor races through
Mills comes down but almost yorks himself, digs out to Shakib who only partly stops it, Mills retains the strike for the next over
gives himself room but Rubel follows him, can only dig it out to cover
drills the full ball outside off straight to cover
tails down leg, struck on the pad, goes to fine leg
backs away and this time hammers a length ball on middle through the covers, much-needed boundary for New Zealand
charges down the track and tries to heave over cover, beats the bat and whizzes over off stump
more problems for New Zealand, Mills looked to deposit the last ball of the Powerplay but Rubel cleverly shortened the length, Mills top-edged high in the air, third man settled under a dolly
walks well across the stumps and nudges it past the keeper
goes back and clips into the vast vacant areas on the leg side
worked to midwicket
hit to point, sets off, had Shakib's throw been on target McCullum would have been miles out
paddle sweeps fine
defends into the off side
jams out a fast yorker on middle
goes back but finds cover with the back-foot drive
paddle sweeps well
again cannot beat cover with the back-foot drive
again the lap sweep is handy for Williamson as he battles cramp
drives down to mid-off
this time the back-foot drive gets him off strike
McCullum moving across and exposing all three stumps well before the delivery, clips airily past midwicket
goes back and nudges to square leg
pushed outside off to counter McCullum's crease movement, can only push meekly back to the bowler
cover dives to save the single
goes back and wristed to the fielder manning the cow corner boundary
punched off the back foot down the pitch
goes down and nails the drive but straight to the fielder. Placement has been the poorest aspect of New Zealand's batting effort today
slower ball on middle, flicked between the stumps and the non-striker down to long-on
defends to cover
drives to cover, Taylor sets off immediately and was probably home had the fielder hit
pulls back the length, slower as well, worked to long-on
moves across and nurdles it with soft hands which allows them to return for two
dropped but a very difficult chance, drills back an on-drive, SHuvo dives across the pitch and gets two hands but can't hold on
worked off middle into the leg side
superb running creates two out of nothing after it was dug out to long-on
looks to work to midwicket, leading edge through the vacant mid-off region down to the deep fielder
swept from off past backward square, more committed and sharp running brings a couple more

drills a length ball outside off  just short of the long-off fielder who fumbles, they race back for two, McCullum runs down the line of the stumps to avoid being run out but the throw from Rubel to the striker's end clocked McCullum on the back of the head
tails into leg stump, goes for the heave over midwicket, clips the pads and goes past off stump
well outside off, toe-ended down to third man attempting to again hit to leg, 200 up for New Zealand
full toss on leg, slugged over midwicket and they come back for an easy two
slower ball outside off beats McCullum who swung to leg early and missed by a considerable distance
short ball, gives room again and flays to long-off
mistimed back to the bowler, who deflects to mid-off
backed away and tried to launch the full ball outside off over cover but missed
hit down to long-off
superb stroke from a crippled Williamson, rocks back to a short ball and pulls away to the boundary piercing the two fielders perfectly
repeats the stroke but to the fielder this time in the deep
pitches outside off and spins away from the nothing stroke of McCullum
flips the short ball into the leg side to move to 99
goes back and swings mightily but along the ground to the fielder in the deep
worked into the leg side, they scamper back for two to complete a superb maiden 100 for Williamson, the youngest New Zealander to score an ODI ton, can he carry his side home, cramp and all?
tails into leg, hits him on the pad, goes into the off side
swings to leg, fine leg fumbles allowing a razor-sharp Taylor to sprint back for two
dug out down the ground to long-off
vital boundary for New Zealand, backs away and slams over cover and bisects the fielders in the deep
slows up the pace and drags it down, skies the pull in the air but falls short of the fielder, Taylor again races back

gone!! came down and Shakib shortened the length and followed him, attempted work to leg scooped up in the air, again fell short of the fielder but an excellent throw from the deep hit the stumps direct to beat McCullum's effort to earn two

Tuffey holes out for a golden duck, went down on one knee and slog swept high in the air straight down long-on's throat, Bangladesh are on the verge of a historic moment in their young cricketing history
played to third man
gets a leading edge into the covers trying to work to midwicket, Williamson keeps strike for the start of the last over
heaves with all his might, mistimed into the vacant leg side, Taylor pushes hard for two
can he pull off the unthinkable?? this time connects well with the heave and beats the diving deep midwicket
that's it!! Bangladesh have won their first ever ODI series against a full strength Full Member opponent! Williamson tried to repeat the stroke, but could only pick out the deep midwicket this time
